body: This is to prepare for ToxAV becoming independent of toxcore internal calls. This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1424)

comment_data.body: If you want, you can make it return an error. It's internal (toxav) only. Maybe log it somewhere. Maybe add an assert, because if this function errors, we have a code bug.
The branches have the same code, so you can put `||` and make it a single if.
This function should return the object-ptr, not set a pointer to the object-ptr.
Make a separate PR for all the unlock/lock and non-recursive mutex changes.
that slipped in there by accident
return and lock won't work together. that's why i did it this way

ah bazel config is missing the new .h file

Comments:

* the two error conditions in tox_friend_send_lossy_packet could be combined into one.

* there are extra brackets in various places, e.g.
`((pktid >= PACKET_ID_RANGE_LOSSY_START) && (pktid <= PACKET_ID_RANGE_LOSSY_END))`,
and a weird newline in tox_callback_friend_lossless_packet_per_pktid,
and another one in the documentation on tox_callback_friend_lossless_packet_per_pktid.

* the API documentation on tox_friend_send_lossy_packet should be
updated with the new range of packets it accepts.

Some suggested rewordings (from irc):

tox.api.h:2672-2673
"The first byte of data was not one of the permitted values; for lossy 
packets the first byte must be in the range 192-254, and for lossless 
packets it must be either 69 or in the range 160-191"

tox.api.h:2719
"The first byte of data must be either 69 or in the range 160-191"

commit.message:
Add new semi-private API functions to set per-packet-id custom handlers.

This is to prepare for ToxAV becoming independent of toxcore internal calls.

Add new semi-private API functions to set per-packet-id custom handlers.

This is to prepare for ToxAV becoming independent of toxcore internal calls.
